statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Portland 70, N. Colorado 63
article.story: PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) -- Nik Raivio scored 15 points and Sherrard Watson added 14 as Portland outlasted Northern Colorado for a 70-63 victory on Friday. Raivio made only 4 of 11 shots but he also contributed five rebounds and four assists, both of which were team highs. Robert Palacios led Northern Colorado with 13 points. The Pilots (4-8) appeared to be in control after jumping to a 38-25 halftime lead. But the visiting Bears (5-6) quickly climbed back into the contest with an 18-4 run to start the second half. That run was capped by Palacios' steal and layup, which gave Northern Colorado a 43-42 lead with 12:30 left in the half. Then, Portland responded with six unanswered points, which gave the Pilots the lead for good. Their deficit was just 56-55 after a basket by Palacios and a three-point play by Neal Kingman, who finished the night with 10 points. But the Pilots gradually widened the margin, thanks to a 10-for-10 effort from the foul line over the final 66 seconds. Portland finished the game 23 of 30 (77 percent) from the foul line but the Pilots hit only 5 of 17 three-point attempts. Northern Colorado was even worse from the three-point line, though, making just 3 of 16 attempts. The Bears also committed 20 turnovers, which led to 23 points for Portland.
